div.l: Ther was no man for ꝑperil durste him touche
A sheffeld Thwitel bare he in his hose
Round was his face and camuse was his nose
As piled as an ape was his sculle
He was a market betere atte fulle
Ther was no wight manwight þat dorst hand on hīm legge
But if he swore he sholde anoon a begge
A thef he was for soþe of corn and mele
And that a sleigh and vsant for to stele
His name was hoten deynous symkyn
A wif he hadde comen of noble kyn
The ꝑperson of the toıı̄un here fader was
Wit hire he yaf ful many a pane of bras
For þat symkyn shulde in his blood allye
She was I fostered In a Nonnerie
For symkyn wolde no wif as he seide
But she were wel y norsshed and a mayde
To sauen his estate of yomanrie
And she was proud ⁊and pert as is a pye
A ful faire sight was it vp on hem two
On halydaies bi forn hire wold he goo
Wit his tipet wonden a bouten his hede
And she cam after in a gyte of rede
And symkyn hadde hosen of þe same
Ther durste no wight clepen hir͗e but dame
Was noon so hardy þat wente by þe way
Þat with hir͗e dorste onys rage or play
But ȝif he wolde be slayn of symkyn
With panade or with knyf or boydekyn
For Ielous folk ben ꝑperilous eủermo
Algate þei wolde here wyues wenden so
And ek for she was somdel smot͗erlich
She was a digne as water in a dich
As ful of hoker and of bismare
Hire þouȝte þat a lady schuld hire spare
What for hire kynrede ⁊and hire nortelrie
That she hadde lerned in þe Nonnerie
A doughter hadde þei bi twixe hem two
Of twenty yer wit outen ony moo
Sauyng a child þat was of half yer age
In cradel it lay and was a ꝓproper page
